intro: Dalechampia reitzkleinii, commonly known as the yellow dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by bracts. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
